snippet: Bo Xilai, the embattled Communist Party chief of Chongqing, said that he had failed to supervise a trusted aide who recently fled to an American consulate, causing a national sensation.
abstract: Bo Xilai, the embattled Communist Party chief of Chongqing, admits to failing to supervise his aide Wang Lijun, who recently fled to an American consulate, causing a national sensation; public concession of error bolsters speculation that his chances are slim to join the top ranks of the Chinese leadership during a change of power this year.
lead_paragraph: Bo Xilai, the embattled Communist Party chief of Chongqing, said that he had failed to supervise a trusted aide who recently fled to an American consulate, causing a national sensation.

headline.seo: Bo Xilai, Ambitious Chinese Party Chief, Admits Failure
headline.main: An Ambitious Chinese Party Chief Admits His Failure to Oversee an Aide
headline.print_headline: An Ambitious Chinese Party Chief Admits His Failure to Oversee an Aide
